lexUnit.name: sensation.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a physical feeling or perception resulting from something that happens to or comes into contact with the body

sentence.text: In age she recollected the sensation of hot tears mixing with cold rain .
Words like blood and loyalty and revenge and endurance awaken something primitive in their auditors , who enjoy the sensation of adrenalin coursing in their veins .
The high that resulted produced sensations of flying , often accompanied by fantastic visions of strange lands .
Sensations of white are not alike in some respect ; they are alike “ altogether ” .
The sensation of pain is a signal to the brain to act immediately to prevent the body from being hurt further .
Hours later she woke to the same sensation of calm fulfilment .
I get an uncomfortable sensation of intrusion .
Soft music flooded through her helmet , and if she ignored the sensation of movement , she could almost pretend she was sitting at home … almost .
To visit Venice gives the sensation of viewing an ancient and famous movie , with each bit player a star name .
The sensation of falling typically occurs at the beginning of the night , during Stage I sleep .
I remember a sensation of being above myself , certainly not in my body anyway .
She went very still , the sensation of being poised too near the edge of a precipice sweeping over her again .
After a very short time their sensations are heightened and they become worried .
Accordingly , our sensations simply are as they are , and error enters only when we make mistaken judgements on their basis .
What one means when one calls something ` white " , according to Mill , is that one 's present sensation resembles a past one .
We know only the existence of our sensations , percepts , and thoughts .
Significant papers on colour sensation appeared in 1871-2 , being followed by work on oceanic circulation , glacier motion , and changes of state .
It is tempting to refer this accuracy of localisation to qualitative differences within the scale of pressure sensations .
She thought she would have to hold on extremely tightly if they were to go any faster , but she thought it was a thrilling , intoxicating sensation to be borne along like this .
He felt flushed and there was a prickling sensation in his legs and hands .
She then felt a choking sensation with increasing wheeze , tightness , and cough and rushed to the nearest accident and emergency department .

He loved this end-of-the-night sensation of hardly being able to think , just feel .

Knowing typically excludes the experience of knowing , doing the sensation of doing .
When your voice is ` forward " , this should make the lips vibrate and cause a tingling sensation .
Creed felt cold , a sensation so immediate and acute that he shivered violently .
